channel.title: Personal Projects on Christian KÃ¼ndig
channel.description: Recent content in Personal Projects on Christian KÃ¼ndig

item.title: Extracting Credit Information from Delisted Mobile Games
item.description: I discovered my MobyGames profile was missing credits from games I worked on. As the games are delisted and can’t be launched anymore, I reverse engineered the asset formats.

item.title: Custom AirPrint Icons with CUPS
item.description: My 20-year-old Samsung printer deserved better than a generic icon. Here’s how I dug through CUPS source code to figure out why printer icons don’t work and the simple Docker volume mount that fixed it.

item.title: My Custom TRMNL Setup For Our Home
item.description: Setting up a TRMNL display at home and building three custom plugins for local weather, the SBB station board, and a simplified family calendar.

item.title: Porting ScummVM to Webassembly, Part 4c - File Access
item.description: Revisiting how files are loaded over the network and finally adding support for cloud storage (Dropbox, Google Drive etc)

item.title: Porting ScummVM to Webassembly, Part 4b - Sound Improvements
item.description: Diving deep into the different audio options ScummVM provides and making sure they work in the browser.

item.title: Porting ScummVM to Webassembly, Part 4a - Maintenance
item.description: Cleaning up some loose ends to get ready for future improvements

item.title: How to avoid dynamically inserted podcast ads (via Youtube)
item.description: Dynamic ad insertion in podcasts is annoying. Here’s how I use Podsync to get ad-free podcast feeds from YouTube instead.

item.title: RetroWave OPL3 Express via Web Serial API
item.description: Authentic sounds from vintage sound chips - using the Yamaha OPL chip (AdLib, Soundblaster etc) in the Chromium.

item.title: Our Wedding Website, 5 Years Later
item.description: Reflecting on the custom wedding website I built in 2019, and how it evolved over the years.

item.title: Fixing Play Suisse in yt-dlp
item.description: yt-dlp support for Play Suisse has been broken since the platform enforced a user login to access any video streams in August 2023. Let’s fix that.

item.title: Porting ScummVM to Webassembly, Part 3
item.description: I finally found some time over the holidays to wrap up some improvements I was working on for ScummVM last year.

item.title: HDHomerun Server Emulation in Tvheadend
item.description: Time to retire tvhProxy by adding HDHomerun emulation to Tvheadend.

item.title: Github Shortcodes for the Hugo Static Page Generator
item.description: I link a lot to various GitHub items, so I built some Hugo shortcodes for it.

item.title: Reverse Engineering the 1995 FMV Game Silent Steel
item.description: Silent Steel is a submarine-themed FMV game released in 1995. This is the summary of it’s file formats, including a prototype re-implementation.

item.title: How to Add the Amphiro Hand Shower to Home Assistant
item.description: Looking into how to reverse engineer a funky christmas present and building out a new Home Assistant integration for it.

item.title: Forwarding Bluetooth with the April Brother BLE Gateway
item.description: We recently moved and I decided to buy a BLE->IP gateway off AliExpress to increase coverage in the bigger place. Turns out this needed some hacking to get it to work with Home Assistant.

item.title: Porting ScummVM to Webassembly, Part 2
item.description: Since merging the initial Webassembly port of ScummVM, I have added a few critical improvements

item.title: HP iLO Integration for Home Assistant
item.description:
I have been using a HP Microserver for a few years as my home lab and quite enjoy it. Unfortunately Home Assistant’s existing HP Integrated Lights-Out (ILO) integration is very limited and does not have any configuration integration. I have started working on an updated version of this integration. For the initial release, I focused on three things:

  • Auto-Discovery with config flow so no configuration.yaml editing will be required.
  • Support for as many sensor types automatically out of the box.
  • Updating python-hpilo.

item.title: Sensirion SCD4x COâ‚‚ Home Assistant Integration
item.description: I recently added support support for the Sensirion SCD4x COâ‚‚ Gadget to the Passive BLE Monitor integration for Home Assistant.

item.title: Porting ScummVM to Webassembly
item.description: Making old adventure (and other) games available on the web.

item.title: Does Steam Remote Play support NvFBC on Linux?
item.description: Trying to get Steam Remote Play working from my Linux home lab, I noticed that while Steam offers capturing the frame data with NvFBC, the setting doesn’t seem have any impact. Why is that?

item.title: Why WebVTT subtitles in Plex don't work
item.description: For some reason video files downloaded from the web won’t play in Plex if they have subtitles.

item.title: tvhProxy: Streaming TVHeadend into Plex DVR
item.description: Plex launched it’s DVR feature in 2016. Unfortunately, it only supports either DVR tuners connected to the server directly or HDHomeRun devices. tvhProxy fixes that.

item.title: Extracting EPG data from the TV7 IPTV service
item.description: Init7, my FTTH provider has a great IPTV offering called TV7 Unfortunately there’s no way to fetch the EPG data.

item.title: Simulating barcode scanning on the web
item.description:
The yearly hackathon at work is always a great time to pursue new ideas or play around in fun ways with existing technology. My entry in 2019 was a humorous take on using simulations when developing computer vision software. I long wondered to see if we could use modern game engines or other simulation technology to augment some of our real world testing at scale.

For the hackathon, I decided to apply my (as you will see quite limited) skills and implement a prototype of such a system.

item.title: Compiling Zork from Scratch
item.description: Today, the source code of many old Infocom Text Adventures has been uploaded to Github. Let’s see if we can compile Zork.

item.title: Product Management Night
item.description:
On November 3rd I had the pleasure to present at the Product Management Night series of the Product Management Festival in Zurich.

This time it was held held at the beautiful NZZ foyer next to the opera house. My presentation focused on how we build deep-tech products a Scandit and how PMs connect technological capabilities and customer value.

I really enjoyed sharing my experiences and connecting with other product managers in my city.

item.title: BrowsePass fork with Dropbox support
item.description:
Living and traveling overseas for more than a year, I want a way to access some of my more secure credentials in case of device loss.

BrowsePass is a static web application to read KDBX files as produced by KeePass. This allows me to securely access my passwords and logins from everywhere - all I need is a computer with a web browser.

As Google isn’t available in all the countries I’m traveling to (ðŸ‘‹ðŸ‡¨ðŸ‡³), I added support for Dropbox to it. The integration is completely client-side and uses Dropbox’ Oauth/Rest Client API.

item.title: Master Thesis: Building an adapting Poker Agent
item.description: I wrote a learning poker bot for my master thesis. This was just at the cusp of the deep learning breakthroughs to come soon after.

item.title: Die Endstation

item.description: Nach den Verlusten mit den UBS-Papieren sind auch die Dollars unseres Wirtschaftskolumnisten nichts mehr wert. Er setzt nun auf den FrÃ¼hling

item.title: Profitieren vom Leid der Bauarbeiter
item.description: Abrupter Kurswechsel: Unser Autor spekuliert ab sofort auf Verluste statt auf Gewinne. Das Opfer: Die Bauindustrie. Doch er hat die Rechnung ohne den Dollar gemacht.

item.title: MeD's Movie Manager for OS X
item.description: My first open source contribution: porting a DVD collection manager to Mac OS X
